title: Poco C75 leaked images show some glitzy color versions
description: A while back the Poco C75 was certified by the FCC on its way to launch, and today we have our first ever leaked renders to look at. These show the device in all three colors in which it will be offered, and while the black one is reasonably subdued, the other two are all glitzy and glamorous - or at least they're trying to be. As you can see, the phone will come in black, gold, and green. It will allegedly be powered by the MediaTek Helio G85 SoC paired with up to 8GB of LPDDR4X RAM and up to 256GB of storage, and will have a 6.88-inch HD+ LCD touchscreen with 120 Hz refresh...
excerpt: This one aims to impress with its looks. A while back the Poco C75 was certified by the FCC on its way to launch, and today we have our first ever leaked...
text: A while back the Poco C75 was certified by the FCC on its way to launch, and today we have our first ever leaked renders to look at. These show the device in all three colors in which it will be offered, and while the black one is reasonably subdued, the other two are all glitzy and glamorous - or at least they're trying to be. As you can see, the phone will come in black, gold, and green. It will allegedly be powered by the MediaTek Helio G85 SoC paired with up to 8GB of LPDDR4X RAM and up to 256GB of storage, and will have a 6.88-inch HD+ LCD touchscreen with 120 Hz refresh rate. Poco C75 leaked images On the rear there's a 50 MP main camera and a 0.08 MP decorative lens. Selfies are going to be taken care of by a 13 MP camera. The phone also boasts a side-mounted fingerprint sensor embedded in the power button, NFC, a 3.5 mm headphone jack, and a 5,160 mAh battery with support for 18W wired charging. Compared to the C65 which launched last year, the new model comes with a larger screen with a higher refresh rate, a higher-res selfie camera, and a slightly bigger battery. The Poco C75 measures 171.9 x 77.8 x 8.2 mm and weighs 204g. That makes it marginally taller, less wide, thicker, and heavier than its predecessor. Source
html:
A while back the Poco C75 was certified by the FCC on its way to launch, and today we have our first ever leaked renders to look at. These show the device in all three colors in which it will be offered, and while the black one is reasonably subdued, the other two are all glitzy and glamorous - or at least they're trying to be.

As you can see, the phone will come in black, gold, and green. It will allegedly be powered by the MediaTek Helio G85 SoC paired with up to 8GB of LPDDR4X RAM and up to 256GB of storage, and will have a 6.88-inch HD+ LCD touchscreen with 120 Hz refresh rate.


Poco C75 leaked images

On the rear there's a 50 MP main camera and a 0.08 MP decorative lens. Selfies are going to be taken care of by a 13 MP camera. The phone also boasts a side-mounted fingerprint sensor embedded in the power button, NFC, a 3.5 mm headphone jack, and a 5,160 mAh battery with support for 18W wired charging.

Compared to the C65 which launched last year, the new model comes with a larger screen with a higher refresh rate, a higher-res selfie camera, and a slightly bigger battery.

The Poco C75 measures 171.9 x 77.8 x 8.2 mm and weighs 204g. That makes it marginally taller, less wide, thicker, and heavier than its predecessor.

Source
